The Other DH    Home
Colophon

This blog was built using Jekyll — a static site generator that converts text files written in Markdown to html, which is then formatted using a combination of css and Liquid templates.

The typography on the site uses a combination of Lekton (designed by isia Urbino), Molengo (designed by Denis Jacquerye), and Alegreya (designed by Juan Pablo del Peral).

The theme for this site, and the basis of the language above describing the tools and fonts used to build it, are by Stephen Ramsay. The technically inclined can fork Stephen Ramsay’s original site, upon which this was based, on GitHub.
